1.text: Pour 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of acidic liquid into 1  c (240 mL) of milk.

2.text: Stir the mixture and let it stand for 5-10 minutes.

3.text: Stir 1.75  tsp (8.6 mL) of cream of tartar into 1  c (240 mL) of milk instead.

4.text: Use your substitute buttermilk as you would the real thing.

5.text: Learn to make real buttermilk if you’re interested in the process.

6.text: Mix 0.75  c (180 mL) of plain yogurt and 0.25  c (59 mL) of water.

7.text: Try sour cream and water in the same 3:1 ratio.

8.text: Combine kefir and water instead at a roughly 3:1 ratio.

9.text: Give thinned yogurt, sour cream, or kefir a try in your recipes.
